parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.
To proclaim, herald, preach. Of uncertain affinity; to herald, especially divine truth.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From basileus; properly, royalty, i.e. rule, or a realm.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Present Infinitive Middle or Passive
str2: To heal, generally of the physical, sometimes of spiritual, disease. Middle voice of apparently a primary verb; to cure.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
(lit: not strong), (a) weak (physically, or morally), (b) infirm, sick. Strengthless.
